intro: Parakeelya stagnensis, commonly known as the swamp lily, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating in water. It thrives in shallow, still waters and is often found in marshes and swamps. Parakeelya stagnensis plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
